article_title: Absolute Lymphocyte Count As Predictor of Overall Survival for Patients with Multiple Myeloma Treated with Single Autologous Stem Cell Transplant: Experience of a Single Centre,
session_type: 731. Clinical Allogeneic and Autologous Transplantation - Results: Poster III
author_names: Rodger E. Tiedemann, MD PhD FRACP FRCPA

abstract_text: Abstract 4121 Post-Autologous stem cell transplant (ASCT) studies have demonstrated that early absolute lymphocyte count (ALC) recovery is associated with prolonged survival in some hematological malignancies. Peripheral blood lymphocytes from Multiple Myeloma (MM) were shown to have direct anti-MM activity by proliferative and cytotoxic responses to autologous and allogeneic myeloma plasma cells View large Download slide View large Download slide View large Download slide View large Download slide View large Download slide View large Download slide Disclosures: Jimenez-Zepeda: J & J: Honoraria.
